Groups Appear for organizations that have Chatter enabled. If you don't add this item to the navigation menu, groups are automatically included in the set of Smart Search Items instead and the Groups item is available from the Recent section. So C is the correct answer.

C.

By adjusting the configuration settings and ensuring that Groups is included in both the Smart Search items and the selected list for the navigation menu, the app builder can resolve the issue and make Groups available as an item on the dropdown menu in the mobile app.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) has a custom Invoice object and a custom Invoice Line Item object. The Invoice Line Item object has a lookup relationship to the Invoice. UC would like to convert the lookup relationship to a master-detail relationship but is unable to do so.

Which two reasons could be preventing this relationship conversion? (Choose two.)

choices.A: There are already two master-detail relationships on the Invoice Line Item.
choices.D: There is a roll-up summary field on the Invoice object.
choices.B: Invoice Line Item records exist without having the Invoice lookup field populated.
choices.C: Custom objects are unable to be on the detail side of a master-detail relationship.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A B for sure!
Correct answer is A & B

Just in case anyone is wondering:
The current relationship between the 2 objects is lookup, you can only make a rollup sum field on objects with a master-detail relationship so it cant be D
We all know you can make roll ups on custom objects so ofc cant be C either 

You cant have more than 2 master details fields per object
You cant change a lookup into master detail if any of the child object records don't have data in that field like wIthorn said below
So the 2 answers have to be A & B
This is 2 possible answers question type. In my opinion second good answer should be B

When converting a lookup relationship to a master-detail relationship, all detail records must have a related master record. If there are records without a populated lookup field, the conversion will fail. Additionally, when a master-detail relationship is established, the detail object cannot have a roll-up summary field, so the conversion will fail if there is a roll-up summary field on the Invoice object.

comments.content: Yup there cant be a roll up already on the field as they haven't converted it yet
D is wrong. You cannot create roll-up on look-up, only master-detail.

discussion.content:
B. Invoice Line Item records exist without having the Invoice lookup field populated.
D. There is a roll-up summary field on the Invoice object.

questions.question_text:
An app builder wants to limit the amount of fields users see when creating a new Opportunity. Once they fill out the required fields and save, the full record page with additional fields relevant to the Opportunity type becomes available.

How could this be accomplished?

discussion.content: D. Make the Opportunity type a required field on the initial Opportunity page layout and use automation to fill in the record type based on the Opportunity type. The app builder can create different record types for each Opportunity type and associate a different page layout with each record type. By making the Opportunity type a required field, the user will be forced to select the type before saving the Opportunity. Then, the app builder can use automation such as a Workflow Rule, Process Builder, or Apex trigger to update the record type based on the Opportunity type. This will ensure that the full record page with additional fields relevant to the Opportunity type becomes available once the required fields are populated and saved.

Selected Answer: D
D is most suitable
